algorithm_technique: Group points by y-coordinate, find min/max x, check for symmetric x-values using a hash set.
Sort points, use two pointers, check for symmetry based on x and y coordinates.
problem_summary_simple: Check if a set of 2D points can be reflected across a vertical line to match themselves.
problem_summary_technical: Determine if points are symmetric about a vertical line by grouping by y and checking x-coordinate reflections.
key_insights: Grouping points by their y-coordinate is crucial for efficient checking.
The reflection line's x-coordinate is the average of the minimum and maximum x-coordinates.
A hash set allows for O(1) average time lookup of reflected points.
Sorting the points can enable a two-pointer approach.
Careful handling of points on the reflection line is needed.
The sorting key needs to consider both x and y coordinates for correct pairing.
